name: Tax The Church: With Richard Holmes

episodes.title: KOGGC Cult Leader David E. Taylor & Michelle Brannon Smuggle Gold Bars From New Zealand!
episodes.description:
Welcome to Tax The Church, hosted by Richard Holmes, a bold and unapologetic Non-Religious, Non-Christian citizen dedicated to exposing the dark underbelly of religious cults, corrupt churches, YouTube “prophets,” and the vast web of financial and criminal misconduct that hides behind the veil of faith in America.

This channel was created out of a deep need for truth, accountability, and justice—especially in spaces that often operate beyond the reach of scrutiny. 

While religion should be a source of comfort, guidance, and community, it has also been exploited by con artists, narcissists, and criminal enterprises that use scripture as a smokescreen and manipulate faith for power and profit.

From secretive compounds to live-streamed sermons, we dissect the mechanics of control, manipulation, and abuse employed by modern-daycult leaders. Whether it’s a fringe sect in the desert or a mega-church with millions of  followers, we explore how these organizations isolate followers, suppress dissent, and enforce obedience—sometimes with devastating consequences.

Behind many charismatic leaders lies a paper trail of deceit. We dig deep into IRS filings, court records, real estate transactions, and whistleblower testimonies to uncover the financial schemes that funnel millions into the pockets of “spiritual leaders.” From Ponzi schemes disguised as “blessings” to money laundering masked as ministry work, we follow the money—and it often leads to disturbing revelations.

Religious organizations frequently engage in shady real estate ventures—buying properties under shell companies, flipping churches for profit, or coercing followers to sign over deeds to their homes in exchange for promises of divine favor. Tax The Church highlights the systemic abuse of nonprofit status and investigates how some churches operate like real estate conglomerates rather than places of worship.

A new breed of self-proclaimed “prophets” is emerging online—gathering massive audiences, donations, and power through social media. With prophetic livestreams, donation links, and apocalyptic warnings, these digital influencers claim to speak for God while raking in tens of thousands of dollars. We analyze their tactics, fact-check their prophecies, and investigate where the money really goes.

Churches enjoy a unique list of legal protections and tax exemptions in the United States. These loopholes have created fertile ground for financial exploitation. We spotlight how certain ministries and religious figures abuse this status to hide assets, avoid taxes, and escape accountability.

We provide detailed investigations that break down complex scams and cult dynamics. These reports include visual evidence, public records, interviews and a thorough breakdown of who’s involved, what laws may have been broken, and who’s profiting.

Religion is one of the most powerful forces in human history. At its best, it inspires compassion, community, and purpose. At its worst, it becomes a tool of psychological coercion, financial exploitation, and criminal behavior—all under the protection of spiritual authority.

In the United States, religious organizations are rarely held accountable. Their financials are largely exempt from transparency laws. Their leaders are elevated to untouchable status. And their followers are often too afraid—or too conditioned—to speak out.

That’s where Tax The Church comes in!
We’re not anti-religion. We’re anti-corruption.
This channel is a voice for the voiceless. A digital watchdog that refuses to look away. A platform where truth outweighs doctrine, and justice speaks louder than false prophecy.

Our viewers come from all walks of life—former cult members, spiritual seekers, journalists, legal experts, and people who simply care about truth and accountability. If you’ve ever questioned a religious leader’s motives, wondered where your donation really went, or watched a “prophet” make wild predictions with no consequences—you’re in the right place.

We always encourage respectful discussion, open inquiry, and evidence-based debate. We welcome whistleblowers, survivors, and investigators to reach out and share what they know at (314)492-3356 or taxthechurch420@gmail.com

If you're tired of watching fraud flourish behind pulpits…
If you believe faith should never be a weapon for control…
If you want to be part of the movement holding these institutions accountable…

Subscribe to Tax The Church: With Richard Holmes
Turn on notifications. Watch. Share. Speak up.
Because the truth deserves a platform. And no one—no matter how holy they claim to be—shouldn't be above any investigation.

Contact & tips are taken seriously, and kept confidential! If you have credible information, documents, or stories to share, please contact us securely. We vet all sources, protect whistleblower identities, and strive to maintain the highest journalistic standards.

All content is considered Fair Use.

Tax The Church
Where Truth Has No Sanctuary!
